text: Dutch filmmaker Theo van Gogh was murdered by Mohammed Bouyeri in Amsterdam East, Netherlands in broad daylight. The director's last words, according to eyewitnesses, were "Mercy mercy! We can talk about this!" ==Attack and death== The murderer Mohammed Bouyeri an Islamic extremist killed van Gogh.Gunman kills Dutch film director. Retrieved 16 July 2014. The reason for murdering Gogh was to oppose the controversial film which criticised Islam Submission. Bouyeri shot van Gogh multiple times. He attached a 5 page letter to van Gogh's chest with a knife. Bouyeri finally then slitting van Gogh's throat and nearly beheading van Gogh, killing him instantly. Bouyeri was arrested by Dutch police force after he was shot in the leg. He was sentenced to life imprisonment without parole. Bouyeri stated that he does not have any regret for murdering van Gogh. He termed the assassination as Jihad. ==Funeral== Van Gogh was buried in Amsterdam on 9 November, 2004. Van Gogh's son claimed that many assassination attempts were made but van Gogh refused to take police protection. ==Hirsi's hiding== Sooner after van Gogh's assassination, Ayaan Hirsi Ali and Geert Wilders went into hiding. This is because Bouyeri made death threats against Hirsi as the writer of the film. ==Memorial (The Scream)== On 18 March 2007, a sculpture honoring van Gogh, entitled De Schreeuw ("The Scream"), was unveiled in Amsterdam. It is located in the Oosterpark, a short distance from where van Gogh was murdered. ==References== == Other websites == * Theo van Gogh memorial defaced with black marker * Full text of speech by Hans Teeuwen Category:2004 in Europe Category:2000s in the Netherlands Category:History of Amsterdam Van Gogh, Theo Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in Europe Category:Murder in 2004 Category:Murders by firearm in Europe
